title: Add "collapse" mode to rerun
body:
Here is the idea as I understand it.  @yarikoptic, please fill in any
of missing details.

Say we have a branch like this:

```
---A---B---C---D---E master
```

Assume A is the first run commit in the line.  If all of these commits
are run commits that produce the same content (or non-run commits),
running

```
$ datalad rerun --mode=collapse --since= --onto=
```

would give the same branch:

```
---A---B---C---D---E master
```

On the other hand, if C marks the first commit where rerunning the
command leads to different content, running the same command above
would result in a tree like this:

```
         C'---D'---E'  (--branch=NAME or detached)
        /
---A---B---C---D---E master
```

At this point, even if D and E produce the same content, they happen
after the first divergence.

Instead of continuing to extend the diverged branch, we could perhaps
also just stop once the first divergence is encountered, and report
the diff.

Re: #2076
